articles.title: A vanished kingdom comes alive in the songs of griots and a new archaeological dig - NPR
articles.description: The legendary west African kingdom of Kaabu has long been memorialized in the songs and stories of griots. That's inspired archaeologists to excavate the kingdom's capital.
articles.content:
Griots are having a moment.
A griot is a storyteller who preserves and passes down history in stories and poems and songs.
They're part of West African culture but the term itself has a bit of colo… [+6855 chars]
